alert.note: Alert for Harnett; Lee; Montgomery; Moore (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 11:00PM EDT until June 27 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Harnett County in central North Carolina... Lee County in central North Carolina... Northeastern Montgomery County in central North Carolina... Moore County in central North Carolina... * Until 200 AM EDT. * At 1100 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sanford, Troy, Carthage, Biscoe, Whispering Pines, Broadway, Robbins, Candor, Vass, Cameron, Glendon, Seven Lakes and Pineview. This includes the following flood prone locations... Little Buffalo Creek near the Riverbirch Shopping Center, Glendon-Carthage Rd and Rascob Rd, Creeks near South Kennedy St in Robbins, Kelly Plantation Rd at Hwy 22 and Little River at Long Point Rd near Vass. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
